It's like a new poll tax.  How many jelly beans are in the jar? We have seen this movie before. This is a blatant attempt to suppress the vote further in Tennessee.

11 of my 15 staff members are smart, capable women who work on important issues like health care, education, trade, housing, foreign relations, the environment and more. When women have a seat at the table to shape our policies, we achieve a stronger democracy.
On this #InternationalWomensDay, I am proud to serve alongside a diverse group of women elected to the 116th Congress – the most ever in history.

It’s official. Cumberland River Hospital is the latest hospital to close due to Tennessee not expanding Medicaid – the most per capita of any state in the country. This isn’t a ranking we should be proud of. The effects are setting in.
 https://www.nashvillepublicradio.org/post/rural-tennessee-town-braces-inevitable-ripple-effects-losing-its-hospital … pic.twitter.com/JQQ9QWJPdR
I encourage you to visit the Civil Rights Room at the downtown @NowatNPL or take a Civil Rights walking tour to draw inspiration for working toward a more just and civil society.

The lunch counter sit-ins and Freedom Rides, led by students who would later become iconic leaders in the movement, were pivotal moments that ultimately led to desegregation of all public facilities in Nashville and inspired protests across the South.
As Black History Month draws to a close, let us all remember the significant role that Nashville played during the Civil Rights Movement.
